tp:docstring.p: In many real-time communication services the user can pay for certain services, typically calls to the PSTN, in advance. In (at least) Skype, it's possible to query the current balance in a machine-readable way.

An amount of money in a specified currency. For example, 3.21 British pounds would conventionally be represented by (Amount = 321, Scale = 2, Currency = "GBP"), but could be represented by (Amount = 3210, Scale = 3, Currency = "GBP") in a service that records balance in units of 0.001 pounds.
As a special case, if Amount = 0, Scale = 2**32 and Currency = "", this indicates an unknown amount.

The amount, expressed as a fixed-point number with decimal scale defined by the Scale property; for instance, an Amount value of 1234 with Scale of 2 represents 12.34 in the currency unit given by the Currency.

The decimal scale for the fixed point value of the Amount property, defining the number of rightmost decimal digits from the integer value which form the fractional part of the resulting currency value.
As well as defining the interpretation of Amount, user interfaces may use this value to determine the precision with which to display the amount.

tp:member.name: Currency
tp:member.tp:docstring: The international currency code represented by this amount, such as "EUR", "USD", or "JPY". An empty string can be used to indicate that the currency is not known.

tp:docstring.p: The user's balance on the account corresponding to this Connection. A negative amount may be possible on some services, and indicates that the user owes money to the service provider.
On initial connection, this property is likely to have an unknown value, represented by Amount = 0, Scale = 2**32 and Currency = "".
On services where ChangeNotification is FALSE, the value of this property contains the last known balance, which will be unknown until a current balance has been downloaded using RequestBalance.
Get the current value of the balance, making a network request to the server or waiting for a previous network request to complete if necessary.
An up-to-date value of the balance.
Emitted when the user's balance has changed. On services where ChangeNotification is FALSE, this will only be emitted if a client calls RequestBalance.
An up-to-date value of the balance.
If TRUE, clients can expect timely notification of changes to the balance. If FALSE, the BalanceChanged signal will not be emitted unless RequestBalance is called.
